result.execSummary:
On one or more charges, the deferred prosecution or sentencing agreement(s) on this case were fulfilled, and the charge(s) were dismissed.

The defendant Darin D Thome was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).
  • Possess Drug Paraphernalia, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.573(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

01:48 PM Defendant Darin D Thome appeared by phone means. Prosecuting Atty Clifford C. Burdon appeared by video for State of Wisconsin.  Agent Ryan Denu appeared by phone means.
Court questions defendant.  Defendant states due to health conditions, he has not been able to complete his conditions of probation.  Defendant believes he can pay in about 1 year.
BY THE COURT:  Court finds defendant has not made a good faith effort to pay off costs.  Court will extend the probation for 1 year and Court will review in about 10-11 months.  If not paid off, Court will look into extending probation and adding jail conditions.  Court advises defendant of right to an attorney.  Agent to prepare the order.

records.addlTxt: Amendment to Judgment of Conviction s/BNB/1-11-17, nunc pro tunc 11/28/16

Attorney Ryan T. Frank appeared by phone means for Defendant Darin D Thome. Prosecuting Atty Chad A. Hendee appeared for State of Wisconsin. Defendant Darin D Thome in court.
Probation Agent Amy Heimann also appears by telephone.
Court received a request from Agent Heimann regarding the defendant's probation due to court obligations that are still due.  Atty Frank received the letter and has reviewed it with his client.
Atty Hendee asks for an extension of probation as outlined in the letter by probation.  Atty Frank responds and states that there is a DPA  on the matter as well and if the State agrees to extend the DPA along with the probation; the defendant would have no objection to extension of the probation.  Atty Hendee agrees to extend the DPA as to the same time period as probation.  Atty Frank does not object to the 12 month extension of probation and of the DPA; if paid earlier, the defense asks if he could be released earlier than that 12 months.
Atty Hendee does not object to that request.

BY THE COURT:   Court will extend Probation until December 4, 2017; if obligations are paid sooner than that date, the defendant may be released at an earlier date.
from Probation/Parole
Probation review hearing on November 28, 2016 at 11:15 am.

records.addlTxt: NOTICE OF VIOATION OF JUDGMENT OF CONVICTION FROM MASO

Defendant Darin D Thome in court with attorney Ryan T. Frank.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Hendee states that there is resolution to the matter.  Atty Hendee files the amended information with the court and the defense.
  Atty Hendee states plea agreement to Counts 1, 2 & 3.    Upon the defendant's plea and prior to adjudication, defendant will enter into a Deferred Prosecution Agreement for a period of: 24 months with conditions on Count 1.  
Court questions Ct. 1.  Atty Frank has no objection.    Defendant received a copy of the amended information & waives it's reading.
Atty Frank agrees.  Court questions the defendant.  Defendant agrees and enters a No Contest plea.
  Court questions defendant regarding plea. Advises of Constitutional Rights and elements of the charge.  Court finds plea made knowingly, voluntarily & Intelligently.

  BY THE COURT:  Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charges.  Court accepts defendant's plea and finds defendant guilty of Counts 2 & 3 and approves the 24 month DPA with conditions on Count 1.

Atty Hendee asks the court to follow the recommendation.
Atty Frank makes a statement to the court.

BY THE COURT:  Ct. 1:  24 month DPA with conditions.

Counts 2 & 3:  Withhold Sentence; 24 months Probation with conditions:
*75 days in the Marquette County Jail w/huber on Count 2
  Report on or before January 31, 2015 by 7:00pm, clean & sober.
*May transfer to Columbia County
*Court Costs = $243.00 on each count
*DNA Surcharge = $200.00 on each count
*AODA and any follow-up treatment
*Not to possess any controlled substance without a valid perscription
*Comply with any counseling recommended by the Agent
*Comply with random drug tests that are recommended by the Agent
Return date on December 4, 2014 at 02:30 pm.

Defendant Darin D Thome in court with attorney Ryan T. Frank.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Hendee states that parties have had discussions on resolution and are close.
Atty Frank agrees and asks for a reset.

BY THE COURT:  Reset.
bond continued.  Return date scheduled for December 4, 2014 at 02:30 pm.
